intro.description:
Welcome to the XML Decryption tutorial for the XML Security Tools.
This tutorial will show you step by step how to decrypt an arbitrary XML document using the XML Decryption Wizard.
To start this tutorial click the Click to Begin button below. You need an encrypted XML document to proceed.
By the way, this tutorial shows only some possibilities of the XML Decryption Wizard. You can find more information in the extensive online help.

item.title: Open an encrypted XML document
item.description: Open an encrypted XML document (you may have created with the XML Encryption Wizard). You can skip this item if your encrypted XML document is already opened in an editor.

item.title: Decrypt the document
item.description:
Now it's time to actually decrypt your XML document. Start the XML Decryption Wizard by clicking on New Decryption... in the context menu XML Security. The wizard consists of one page.
On this page you have to select the keystore containing the used key (you may have created this keystore in the XML Encryption Wizard) and enter the used key. Both, keystore and key, may require a password which you have to enter as well. After that you can select an encryption ID in the Encryption ID drop down box. In case there are no encryption IDs contained in the XML document you can only select to encrypt the first discovered encryption in the document.
Your XML document will be decrypted after clicking on Finish. If not you may have entered some incorrect information in the wizard. In this case launch the wizard again and enter the correct information.
